column4: hi again, changed hd from intel 64 bit pc to amd 65 bit pc...running 10.04.  When i go to boot I get errors like i/o error sda, sector xxxxxxxx and other errors like unhandled error code, result hostbyte:did_bad_target etc.  Any ideas?
could this have something to do with setup of hdd in bios (right now on IDE, could be set to RAID) etc.
other OS windows boots fine and works on same HDD
checked other rogue devices, such as optical drive?
disconnected all optical drives.....still getting error that says call trace, bunch of text and numbers....ext4 etc.
can you try different data cable?
do you think it has anything to do with raid etc in bios
is this a pata drive? are you using it in the correct end of the ribbon (not the middle one)
just in case try another sata cable
another port even could help, sure disable the raid mode if possible in the bios, and try using ahci or not (sometimes one mode works better)
which kernel version (or ubuntu release)?
try lsb_release -a in a console
maybe a newer kernel works better with that sata chipset... which is why
don't use the raid thing, just disable it if you can. ahci could help
same thing with ahci....reverting back to just plain ide
it is trying to do sata stuff, says revalidation failed, sata link up 1.5gb etc. etc.
maybe try a newer kernel?
dont have newer kernel to try right now...just tried older one and same thing....what was the console command u wanted me to try
depending on your release, you could simply try getting 3 debs from here http://kernel.ubuntu.com/~kernel-ppa/mainline/ one for architecture, headers and all
i dont know how to do what you are saying....cant get on the machine...cant get past the errors...
u in here?
calling Artemis 3
ready to try fixing machine again....
